title: Ticket #4695: Force all file opens (open/fopen) to be binary
description:
Not all uses of open/fopen for writing (and perhaps others) correctly set the binary flag (O_BINARY/"b"). As a result, some files written on Windows have \r\n instead of \n. This complicates some other code; for example .FOO_address files are \r\n, which can and have confused the tests which are largely written in Perl.

Perhaps we should wrap open/fopen with a version that forces the binary flag, then poison the original names so they're not accidentally used.

This will probably break file compatibility in some caes!
